item.title: Letha add a quote by Rebecca Solnit
item.description: "Many love stories are like the shells of hermit crabs, though others are more like chambered nautiluses, whose architecture grows with the inhabitant and whose abandoned smaller chambers are lighter than water and let them float in the sea." -- Rebecca Solnit

item.title: Letha add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Letha add a quote by Rebecca Solnit
item.description: "Sense of place is the sixth sense, an internal compass and map made by memory and spatial perception together." -- Rebecca Solnit

item.title: Letha add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Find out the reason that commands you to write; see whether it has spread its roots into the very depth of your heart; confess to yourself you would have to die if you were forbidden to write." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Letha add a quote by Rebecca Solnit
item.description: "The process of transformation consists mostly of decay." -- Rebecca Solnit

item.title: Letha add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Listen--are you breathing just a little, and calling it a life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Letha add a quote by Rebecca Solnit
item.description: "The stars we are given. The constellations we make. That is to say, stars exist in the cosmos, but constellations are the imaginary lines we draw between them, the readings we give the sky, the stories we tell." -- Rebecca Solnit

item.title: Letha add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "You do not have to be good. You do not have to walk on your knees for a hundred miles through the desert, repenting. You only have to let the soft animal of your body love what it loves. Tell me about despair, yours, and I will tell you mine. Meanwhile the world goes on. Meanwhile the sun and the clear pebbles of the rain are moving across the landscapes, over the prairies and the deep trees, the mountains and the rivers. Meanwhile the wild geese, high in the clean blue air, are heading home again. Whoever you are, no matter how lonely, the world offers itself to your imagination, calls to you like the wild geese, harsh and exciting â€“ over and over announcing your place in the family of things." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Letha add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and the only way, it does not exist." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Letha add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Letha add a quote by Tere Michaels
item.description: "You curse a lot." "Fuck you - I hardly curse at all." -- Tere Michaels

item.title: Letha add a quote by Theodore Roethke
item.description:
"<b>The Waking</b>
I wake to sleep, and take my waking slow. I feel my fate in what I cannot fear. I learn by going where I have to go.
We think by feeling. What is there to know? I hear my being dance from ear to ear. I wake to sleep, and take my waking slow.
Of those so close beside me, which are you? God bless the Ground! I shall walk softly there, And learn by going where I have to go.
Light takes the Tree; but who can tell us how? The lowly worm climbs up a winding stair; I wake to sleep, and take my waking slow.
Great Nature has another thing to do To you and me, so take the lively air, And, lovely, learn by going where to go.
This shaking keeps me steady. I should know. What falls away is always. And is near. I wake to sleep, and take my waking slow. I learn by going where I have to go." -- Theodore Roethke

item.title: Letha add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Letha add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "For whatever we lose (like a you or a me), It's always our self we find in the sea." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Letha add a quote by Virginia Satir
item.description: "I want to love you without clutching, appreciate you without judging, join you without invading, invite you without demanding, leave you without guilt, criticize you without blaming, and help you without insulting. If I can have the same from you, then we can truly meet and enrich each other." -- Virginia Satir

item.title: Letha add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Letha add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "I am against religion because it teaches us to be satisfied with not understanding the world." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Letha add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "It seems to me that almost all our sadnesses are moments of tension, which we feel as paralysis because we no longer hear our astonished emotions living. Because we are alone with the unfamiliar presence that has entered us; because everything we trust and are used to is for a moment taken away from us; because we stand in the midst of a transition where we cannot remain standing. That is why the sadness passes: the new presence inside us, the presence that has been added, has entered our heart, has gone into its innermost chamber and is no longer even there, - is already in our bloodstream. And we don't know what it was. We could easily be made to believe that nothing happened, and yet we have changed, as a house that a guest has entered changes. We can't say who has come, perhaps we will never know, but many signs indicate that the future enters us in this way in order to be transformed in us, long before it happens. And that is why it is so important to be solitary and attentive when one is sad: because the seemingly uneventful and motionless moment when our future steps into us is so much closer to life than that other loud and accidental point of time when it happens to us as if from outside. The quieter we are, the more patient and open we are in our sadnesses, the more deeply and serenely the new presence can enter us, and the more we can make it our own, the more it becomes our fate." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Letha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Heaven has mercifully decreed that the secrets of all hearts are hidden so that we are lured on for ever to suspect something, perhaps, that does not exist." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Letha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Illusions are to the soul what atmosphere is to the earth." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Letha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Thoughts are divine." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Letha add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Better was it to go unknown and leave behind you an arch, then to burn like a meteor and leave no dust." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Letha add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Letha add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Letha add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "The Chinese use two brush strokes to write the word 'crisis.' One brush stroke stands for danger; the other for opportunity. In a crisis, be aware of the danger--but recognize the opportunity." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Letha add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Letha add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Letha add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "It is a tremendous act of violence to begin anything. I am not able to begin. I simply skip what should be the beginning." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Letha add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Do not assume that he who seeks to comfort you now, lives untroubled among the simple and quiet words that sometimes do you good. His life may also have much sadness and difficulty, that remains far beyond yours. Were it otherwise, he would never have been able to find these words." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Letha add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "For beauty is nothing but the beginning of terror which we are barely able to endure, and it amazes us so, because it serenely disdains to destroy us. Every angel is terrible." -- Rainer Maria Rilke
